amendatorysection.catchline: Opinion of appellate court; certified to clerk of district court.
amendatorysection.para: It shall be the duty of the Clerk of the Supreme Court immediately upon the entering of a judgment by the Court of Appeals or Supreme Court to certify without cost a copy of the opinion of the court to the clerk of the district court from which the appeal was prosecuted.

annotation.para: Opinion of Supreme Court, duly certified, must be filed in the case in the trial court. Equitable Life Assur. Soc. v. Gillan, 70 F.Supp. 640 (D. Neb. 1945).
